sage.animation

Class Joint

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.animation.Joint

  • public class Joint
extends java.lang.Object
    Joint represents a joint in the animation skeleton for a model. A Joint has a name, an integer , a parent joint (unless it is the root joint of the model), and potentially one or more child Joints. Each Joint also has the following components:
    • A set of initial transformations which specify the rotation and translation (relative to the parent joint) for the initial (non-animated, "at-rest" or "pose position") orientation of the Joint.
    • A fromParentSpace transformation which transforms the initial ("at-rest") parent joint coordinate system to the initial ("at-rest") coordinate system of this Joint.
    • A fromModelSpace transformation which transforms the model space coordinate system to the initial ("at-rest") coordinate system of this Joint. The fromModelSpace transform is the concatenation of the fromParentSpace transforms of all the ancestor joints of this Joint. (Note that the inverse of the fromModelSpace transform gives the transform which will convert vertices from model space to the space of this Joint.)
    • An animationFromParentSpace transformation which transforms objects in the parent joint coordinate system (with all appropriate animation transforms already applied in the parent) to objects in the the coordinate system of this Joint given that the joint has "moved" due to the current animation transform.
    • An animationFromModelSpace transformation which transforms objects the model space coordinate system to the coordinate system of this Joint. The animationFromModelSpace transform is the concatenation of the animationFromParentSpace transforms of all the ancestor joints of this Joint; this is the transform which is used to animate a vertex attached to this Joint (given that the vertex has first been transformed to this joint's coordinate space by the application of the Joint's fromModelSpace transform).

    Note that Joint refers to the structure sometimes known as a bone in other game engines; in fact, Sage keeps track of Joints using the attribute boneID.

    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Joint()
      Constructs a Joint with a unique integer boneID, a name formed by concatenating the String "Joint" with the assigned boneID, an empty children list, all transformations set to Identity, and a null parent reference.
      Joint(java.lang.String name, int boneID)
      Constructs a Joint with the specified name and boneID, and other attributes as defined by constructor Joint().

      Constructs a Joint with the specified name and boneID, the specified from-parent-space transformations, and other attributes as defined by constructor Joint(String,int).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Joint

        public Joint()
        Constructs a Joint with a unique integer boneID, a name formed by concatenating the String "Joint" with the assigned boneID, an empty children list, all transformations set to Identity, and a null parent reference.

        Note that this constructor is intended to be called internally; clients should use one of the other constructors to create Joints.

      • Joint

        public Joint(java.lang.String name,
             int boneID)
        Constructs a Joint with the specified name and boneID, and other attributes as defined by constructor Joint().
        Parameters:
        boneID - the ID to be assigned to this Joint
        name - the name to be assigned to this Joint; if null, the name is ignored and the internally-defined (default) name is used instead

      • Joint

        public Joint(java.lang.String name,
             int boneID,
             float[] translation,
             float angle,
             float[] axis)
        Constructs a Joint with the specified name and boneID, the specified from-parent-space transformations, and other attributes as defined by constructor Joint(String,int).
        Parameters:
        translation - the translations in X,Y,Z from this Joint's parent Joint space
        angle - the angle of rotation from this Joint's parent Joint space
        axis - the axis axis of rotation from this Joint's parent Joint space

      • setInitialTranslation

        public void setInitialTranslation(float tx,
                                  float ty,
                                  float tz)
        This method sets this Joint's initial translation relative to this Joint's parent Joint space.
        Parameters:
        tx - The translation in X from the parent Joint space
        ty - The translation in Y from the parent Joint space
        tz - The translation in Z from the parent Joint space

      • setInitialRotation

        public void setInitialRotation(float angle,
                               float rx,
                               float ry,
                               float rz)
        This method sets this Joint's initial rotation relative to this Joint's parent Joint space.
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle in degrees to rotate
        rx - The X component of the axis of rotation
        ry - The Y component of the axis of rotation
        rz - The Z component of the axis of rotation

      • hasParentJoint

        public boolean hasParentJoint()
        This method checks to see whether this Joint has a parent.
        Returns:
        True if this Joint has a parent, false otherwise

      • getParent

        public Joint getParent()
        This method gets the parent Joint of this Joint.
        Returns:
        The parent Joint.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns a String giving the name of this Joint. Note that Strings are immutable and there is no setName() method in this class; this is to insure that the Joints name cannot be made inconsistent with the name in the external model file from which this Joint was constructed.

      • getBoneID

        public int getBoneID()
        Returns the integer ID assigned to this Joint.
        Returns:
        the Joint ID

      • addChild
